alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Howard; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 3:19AM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Howard, York, and Hamilton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon today to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.
